snippet: Prime Minister Antonis Samaras’s decision to close the state broadcaster last week has created a rift among the members of the governing coalition that could lead to early elections.
abstract: Leaders of Greece's increasingly fragile governing coalition will meet in an effort to mend deepening rift over decision by conservative Prime Min Antonis Samaras to close country's state broadcaster, Hellenic Broadcasting Corporation; debate over shutdown is intensifying, and could force early elections if no compromise is found.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Antonis Samaras’s decision to close the state broadcaster last week has created a rift among the members of the governing coalition that could lead to early elections.

headline.main: Greek Leaders to Meet in Effort to Save Government
headline.print_headline: Greek Leaders to Meet in Effort to Save Government
